basics.name: CJ Avilla
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: Experienced software engineer, educator, and technical team builder.

work.summary: Open Online Platform for Vacation Rental Property Managers
highlights: Integrated third party listing sites to provide channel management.

work.summary: InsideAI is a service that provides realtime alerts of actionable stock trading signals.
highlights: Designed and Architected every piece of the system
Worked with multiple open source library contributers (sec_query and koudoku) to stabilize and add features needed by InsiderAI
Developed versioned and well tested Rails API.
Built user facing dashboard in Backbone.js.
Built a hybrid mobile app using Ionic (Angular) (available in the Apple App Store today).

work.summary: App Academy is an immersive 12 week web development and job placement program in San Francisco and New York.
highlights: Live code lecture about Ruby, SQL, Rails, Javascript, Backbone and Performance.
Taught 330+ students with a 98% placement at companies including Google, Facebook, LinkedIn and Apple.
Lead development of multiple applications and team of instructors.
Developed tool for managing huge database of complex labware definitions
Quickly ramped up on and contributed to a codebase with 1 million lines of code
Implemented stock chart in javascript for interactive visualization of insider trading data
Invented new style of chart to visualize price movements surrounding insider trading events
Developed WCF web service to expose data in json format

awards.title: Bronze Star Medal
awards.summary: Requested by name by multiple Brigade Commanders to control tactical network of western region of Afghanistan.

references.name: Dylan Clark
references.reference: I've had the pleasure of working with CJ as both a student and coworker; I can attest to his diligent work ethic and outstanding character. As a student, CJ was a tenacious learner, often going above and beyond to understand the material deeper than I. He was quick to help other students and make sure his peers understood the material and were keeping up in class.  As a coworker, CJ was always available to discuss in-depth technical problems I encountered. Often he would provide insight that I myself had missed. He has helped me continue my growth as a developer and teacher, taking the initiative to plan lunchtime talks about new technologies, and interesting data-structures & algorithms.  CJ is a thoughtful, caring, well-rounded hacker, full of enthusiasm and charm. I recommend him wholeheartedly! He would be a lucky addition to any team.
